purpleculture_pinyin:
kuī
to peep; to pry into
подглядывать; заглядывать в
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 窥)
Pictophonetic: 規 indicates the sound; 穴 (hole) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
窺視 [ kuī shì ]: to peep at; to spy on; to peek
窺探 [ kuī tàn ]: to pry into or spy on; to snoop; to peep; to poke one's nose into; to peer; to get a glimpse of
窺伺 [ kuī sì ]: to spy upon; to lie in wait for (an opportunity)
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿱ Above to below
    • 穴 [ xué ] cave, den, hole
    • 規 [ guī ] rules, regulations, customs, law
heisig_chinese_memo: Ladies, I apologize for peeping through the hole, but, you know, it's just standard protocol and I'm following my own regulations.
Ru_Meaning: lie in wait, spy on, reconnoiter
Ru_Words:
窺ううかがう
  • наблюдать, следить за чем-л., высматривать что-л
  • видеть, усматривать
    • warodai
    窺くのぞく
  • заглядывать, мельком взглянуть, выглядывать, подглядывать
    • 窺知するきちする
  • узнавать, дознаваться, получать представление
    • warodai
    窺い知るうかがいしる
  • видеть, усматривать, знать (из чего-л., на основании чего-л.)
    • warodai
Ru_Radicals: 一 (один), ハ, 大 (большой), 宀 (значок У), 穴 (дыра), 見 (видеть)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: a standard (規) hole (穴) lets you peep
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Standard regulations in any city are that you can't walk around and peep through a hole at people when they are changing in their homes.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the " acupoints ", " regulations " sound. The original meaning is to see from the pores. "Shuowen": "Peep, look down. From the acupoints, regulate the sound." Xu Kai's "Shuowen Jiezi Biography": "Look at the acupoints." Such as "Mencius. Teng Wengong 2": "Drill into the hole to see each other, if you go beyond the wall and follow each other, the parents and the people of the country are cheap." "Historical Records. The Biography of Bian Que Cang: "The Master is a Fang, if you look at the sky from a limited perspective, you can look at the text with Qi."

" Peep " The idea has secretly peep, peeping meaning. Such as "Book of Rites. "Shao Yi": "Don't peek at the secret, don't stand by, don't talk about the old things, don't play with sex." Zheng Xuan's note: "Peeking, suspecting people's privacy. Secrets, hidden music." "Han Feizi. "Beijing": "Therefore, a person who is a minister, there is no need to look at the heart of the monarch." It also means to watch and covet, such as "Warring States Policy. "Yan Ce III": "You don't go beyond the realm of Chu, and you don't see beyond the border town." Jia Yi of the Western Han Dynasty, "New Book. "Over the Qin Dynasty": "Qin Xiaogong, according to Weihan's solid, supports the land of Yongzhou, and the monarchs and ministers stick to the Zhou room."

" Peep " can also broadly refer to watching and seeing. "Warring. "Qi Ceyi" "Which one looks at it, thinks that it is inferior; while looking through the mirror, it is too far away." "Lü Shi Chunqiu. "Guidang" "Peep the red flesh while the black magpies gather", Gao Luu's note: "Peep, see."

There are similar examples of " rules " and " peep " in ancient books, such as "Huainanzi. "Qi Su", "Anyone who knows the world and looks at me", "Wen Zi. "Ethics" " sees " as " regulation ". Yinqueshan Han Bamboo Slips "Grandson. "The Real and the Void" "then the deep and the Buddha can also rule", and this " rule " is used as a " peek ". See " Regulations ". " Peep " and " Peep " are often used in common. "The Analects. "Zi Zhang" "Give a glimpse of the goodness of the house", Liu Baonan justice: "Geep, "Interpretation" for glimpses, the emperor and Song Shijing are the same. The meaning is different but the sound is close, so the two characters are common." See " Geep "

There is a glyph " 𧠹 " from the sound of " see " and " Guy " in the materials on bamboo and silk. "Mawangdui. The 9th line of "Lao Zi Yi Ben": "Don't 𧠹 (peep) in [牖], to know the way of heaven." " 𧠹 " means " peep ". "Shangbo Bamboo Book II. "Rong Chengshi" bamboo slip 10 "Yu acupoint 𧠹 (見)焉", also uses " 𧠹 " to mean " peep ". " 𧠹 " should be a variant of " peep ". (Li Shoukui, Qu Bing, Sun Weilong, Qiu Xigui, Guo Yongbing)
humanum_short_description_en: From " acupoint ", " regulation " sound. The original meaning is to see from the pores.
humanum_full_description:
從「穴」，「規」聲。本義是從孔隙中看。《說文》：「窺，小視也。从穴，規聲。」徐鍇《說文解字繫傳》：「視之於隙穴也。」如《孟子．滕文公下》：「鑽穴隙相窺，踰牆相從，則父母國人皆賤之。」《史記．扁鵲倉公列傳》：「夫子之為方也，若以管窺天，以郄視文。」

　　「窺」引申有暗中窺視、偷窺的意思。如《禮記．少儀》：「不窺密，不旁狎，不道舊故，不戲色。」鄭玄注：「窺，嫌伺人之私也。密，隱曲處也。」《韓非子．備內》：「故為人臣者，窺覘其君心也無須臾之休。」也表示窺伺、覬覦，如《戰國策．燕策三》：「足下不踰楚境，不窺於邊城之外。」西漢賈誼《新書．過秦上》：「秦孝公據崤函之固，擁雍州之地，君臣固守，以窺周室。」

　　「窺」亦可泛指觀看、看見。《戰國策．齊策一》「孰視之，自以為不如；窺鏡而自視，又弗如遠甚。」《呂氏春秋．貴當》「窺赤肉而烏鵲聚」，高誘注：「窺，見也。」

　　古書中「規」、「窺」有相通的例子，如《淮南子．齊俗》「庸遽知世之所自窺我者乎」，《文子．道德》「窺」作「規」。銀雀山漢簡《孫子．實虛》「則深間弗能規也」，今本「規」作「窺」。參見「規」。「窺」、「闚」也經常通用。《論語．子張》「窺見室家之好」，劉寶楠正義：「窺，《釋文》作闚，皇本、宋石經同。義別而音近，故二字通用。」參見「闚」。

　　簡帛材料中有一個從「見」，「圭」聲的字形「𧠹」。《馬王堆．老子乙本》第9行：「不𧠹（窺）於[牖]，以知天道。」以「𧠹」表示「窺」。《上博竹書二．容成氏》簡10「余穴𧠹（窺）焉」，也是以「𧠹」表示「窺」。「𧠹」應該是「窺」的異體。（李守奎、曲冰、孫偉龍、裘錫圭、郭永秉）
humanum_short_description: 從「穴」，「規」聲。本義是從孔隙中看。

窺 (Simplified: 窥)
Pinyin: kuī
English Definition: to peep; to pry into
Total strokes: 16; Radical: 穴
Pictophonetic: 規 indicates the sound; 穴 (hole) conveys the meaning.
Character Formation:
  • ⿱ Above to below
    • 穴 [ xué ] cave, den, hole
    • 規 [ guī ] rules, regulations, customs, law
Example Words:
窺視 [ kuī shì ]: to peep at; to spy on; to peek
窺探 [ kuī tàn ]: to pry into or spy on; to snoop; to peep; to poke one's nose into; to peer; to get a glimpse of
窺伺 [ kuī sì ]: to spy upon; to lie in wait for (an opportunity)

Meaning: peep

Story: Standard regulations in any city are that you can't walk around and peep through a hole at people when they are changing in their homes.
Kind: traditional

窺字的基本解释

窺
kuī
见“窥”。

窺字的汉语字典释义

[①]［kuī］
［《廣韻》去隨切，平支，溪。］
“窥1”的繁体字。
(1)暗中偷看。
(2)泛指观看。
(3)看透；觉察。
(4)伺机图谋；觊觎。
(5)企求。
(6)回顾；怀念。
[②]［kuǐ］
［《集韻》犬繠切，上紙，溪。］
“窥2”的繁体字。通“跬1”。
(1)半步。言一举足即到。
(2)引申为到。

窺字的康熙字典解释

【午集下】【穴字部】　窺； 康熙笔画：16； 页码：页868第05
【唐韻】去隨切【集韻】【韻會】缺規切，?音魁。【說文】小視也。【廣雅】窺視也。【論語】窺見室家之好。【玉篇】亦作闚。【莊子·秋水篇】用管闚天。　又【集韻】犬蘂切。同跬。半步也。【司馬法】凡人一舉足曰跬。跬，三尺也。兩舉足曰步。步，六尺也。【前漢·息夫躬傳】雖有武蠭精兵，未有能窺左足而先應者也。【註】窺，音跬，半步也。

窺字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
窺字的起名意思

暂无。

peep
Basic explanation of words
peep
kuī
See "Peep".
peep
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①] [kuī]
["Guangyun" go to free cut, flat branch, stream. ]
Traditional characters for "Peep 1".
(1) Peek secretly.
(2) Refers generally to viewing.
(3) See through; perceive.
(4) Waiting for an opportunity to plot; coveting.
(5) Aspiration.
(6) Retrospect; nostalgia.
[②]［kuǐ］
["Ji Yun" cut the dog, put on paper, stream. ]
Traditional characters for "Peep 2". Same as "Lie 1".
(1) Half a step. Just one stroke of the word.
(2) By extension.
peep
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Afternoon Set 2] [Acupoint Word Department] 　 Glimpse; Kangxi Strokes: 16; Page Number: Page 868 No. 05
[Tang Yun] Go with the cut [Ji Yun] [Yun Hui] Cut without rules,? Yinkui. [Said the text] Xiao Shi also. [Guang Ya] Peeping too. [The Analects] See the goodness of Shijia. [Jade articles] also give a glimpse. 【Zhuangzi·Autumn Water】Give a glimpse into the sky.　[Jiyun] Kunirui cut. The same. Half a step too. [Sima Law] The mortal said limping in one fell swoop. Lie, three feet also. Two steps are enough. Step, six feet also. 【Previous Han·Shifu Biography】Although there are elite martial arts soldiers, there is no one who can see the left foot and respond first. [Note] Peep, sound lame, half a step too.
